The Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FD&C Act)
============================================

The Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FD&C Act), enacted in 1938, is a key law that empowers the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to ensure the safety and proper labeling of food, drugs, medical devices, and cosmetics. The act aims to protect public health by requiring that these products are safe, effective, and accurately labeled. Over the years, it has been amended to address new scientific and technological developments.
